job_title: Lab Tech II (Lab Manager) in Riverside, CA
pros: RCCD provides a fairly relaxed environment and the facilities are well kept. The work is enjoyable, and the majority of the staff personnel really make the experience worthwhile. The pay is on the high side for education positions, and the benefits are generous.
cons: The faculty and upper management are are, for the most part, a group of whiny disgraceful excuses for professionals I have ever encountered. I have worked with many school systems in the past, but never have I met more lazy self-indulged faculty than here. The general attitude here seems to not be geared toward helping students. Most of the faculty, with a few exceptions, seem to only want to get in and get out as quickly as possible. Many are even downright rude. I think the only thing that may possibly be worst than being staff here is being a student here. On top of everything, it takes forever to get anything done (even by college standards).

pros: Supportive to students, adaptable to covid-19
cons: Would hope for more of a focus on pharmacology

pros: Great pay, benefits, and flexible work week/hours.
cons: Administrators and Managers fail to communicate. Toxic environment in terms of office politics.

review_title: Good for FT, Bad for PT
pros: Highest pay rate in the area-around $70.00 an hour. Big main campus with two newer colleges in the district. Lots of resources available*. They do offer health insurance for PT faculty, although the employee pays 1/2 of their own policy and the rest for their family ($800.00+/mo for family coverage)
cons:
*Resources that are available are hidden, locked, and require specialized training to gain access. For example, to use the projector in a classroom I had to complete a 10 min training on how to turn on a computer to get a key to the cabinet. I also must jump through hoops every semester to get a BlackBoard site for my class.

If administration has any regard for adjunct faculty (and they mostly don't)  they are treated like a necessary  annoyance that can be easily replaced. Don't count on regular classes, security, appreciation for years of exceptional service, or even an interview if a FT position opens.

review_title: Anything you say Can and will be used Against you!
job_title: Service Officer in Moreno Valley, CA
pros: The Riverside Community College Police Department does teach you discipline, self respect, duty and honor however there is a price for this loyalty.
cons: All R.C.C.P.D. police officers full time and reserve need to realize that the Community Service Officer is there to assist not shoulder the majority of the work load because the officer does believe that they are above all duties as assigned. No it is not easy work Yes it is tedious and boring and sometimes you will get dirty but this is the business you've chosen...
